meta.name: description
meta.content: Monroe is a community of nearly 19,000 residents. Founded in 1823, Monroe offers award-winning schools, safe neighborhoods, beautiful parks, and sustained growth in local business and industry. Monroe is a family-oriented community that offers beautiful recreational facilities and a variety of local restaurants and retail shopping. Monroe is proud to be the home of not only small businesses, but larger companies in industries such as energy, manufacturing, warehousing & distribution – all while maintaining our small-town, New England charm.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Town Of Monroe, CN, Connecticut, USA,‎ Government and Services, ‎About Monroe, ‎Monroe Senior Center

Alert Message - To streamline the data collection process and ensure accurate and efficient reporting, the State of Connecticut has created a dedicated public self-reporting link for the public to report damages to homes and businesses. This portal will enable the gathering of comprehensive information regarding the damages incurred and identify areas where to direct damage assessment teams. The public self-reporting link is below.
Here is the self-reporting link:https://crisistrack.juvare.com/public/CTDEMHS/request.html

Alert Message - The Monroe Town Hall Offices, Library, Highway Department, Senior Center and Food Pantry will be closed on Monday, September 2nd in observance of Labor Day.
Normal hours will resume on Tuesday, September 3rd.
Recycling will not be picked up on Monday, September 2nd. All pickups will be delayed one day that week.
The Spring Hill Road Transfer Station and Garder Road Landfill will be open on Saturday, August 31st.
Our office is located at 7 Fan Hill Road Monroe, Connecticut 06468
Join us in our Facebook page

div.h3: Welcome to the Town of Monroe
div.p: Monroe is a community of nearly 19,000 residents. Founded in 1823, Monroe offers award-winning schools, safe neighborhoods, beautiful parks, and sustained growth in local business and industry.
Monroe is a family-oriented community that offers beautiful recreational facilities and a variety of local restaurants and retail shopping.

Monroe is proud to be the home of not only small businesses, but larger companies in industries such as energy, manufacturing, warehousing & distribution – all while maintaining our small-town, New England charm.
Terrence P. Rooney, First Selectman

div.p: Monday - Thursday: 8:30am - 4:30pm

To streamline the data collection process and ensure accurate and efficient reporting, the State of Connecticut has created a dedicated public self-reporting link for the public to report damages to homes and businesses. This portal will enable the gathering of comprehensive information regarding the damages incurred and identify areas where to direct damage assessment teams. The public self-reporting link is below.
Here is the self-reporting link:https://crisistrack.juvare.com/public/CTDEMHS/request.html

The Monroe Town Hall Offices, Library, Highway Department, Senior Center and Food Pantry will be closed on Monday, September 2nd in observance of Labor Day.
Normal hours will resume on Tuesday, September 3rd.
Recycling will not be picked up on Monday, September 2nd. All pickups will be delayed one day that week.
The Spring Hill Road Transfer Station and Garder Road Landfill will be open on Saturday, August 31st.
